definition: (old) to transport by water/to ship grain as tax

sentences.english: At the turn of the Ming and Qing Dynasties, because transportation prosperity brought Liaocheng cultural development.
sentences.chinese: 明清之交，由於漕運興盛帶來了聊城文化事業的發展。

sentences.english: The orderly management of canal transportation provided the prerequisite to the economic prosperity.
sentences.chinese: 漕運的有序管理，爲經濟的繁榮發展提供了前提條件。

sentences.english: Sea-freight is the main manner of water transportation in Yuan Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 海運是元代漕運的主要方式。

sentences.english: Due to its grain transport functions, the Chiang-hsi wei-so lingered on into the Ch'ing dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 入清以後，江西衛所因爲漕運功能而殘存下來。

definition: Zhang Juzheng (1525-1582), Grand Secretary during the Ming dynasty, credited with bringing the dynasty to its apogee
Zanhuang county in Shijiazhuang 石家莊|石家庄[Shi2 jia1 zhuang1], Hebei
Jianli county in Jingzhou 荊州|荆州[Jing1 zhou1], Hubei
Runzhou district of Zhenjiang city 鎮江市|镇江市[Zhen4 jiang1 shi4], Jiangsu
Yongji county level city in Yuncheng 運城|运城[Yun4 cheng2], Shanxi
Jiangling county in Jingzhou 荊州|荆州[Jing1 zhou1], Hubei

History of the Early Tang Dynasty, sixteenth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled under Liu Xu 劉昫|刘昫[Liu2 Xu4] in 945 during Later Jin 後晉|后晋[Hou4 Jin4] of the Five Dynasties, 200 scrolls
Western Jin dynasty 西晋 historian, author of History of the Three Kingdoms 三國志|三国志
Liu Yuan, warlord at the end of the Western Jin dynasty 西晋, founder of Cheng Han of the Sixteen Kingdoms 成漢|成汉 (304-347)
